modules.name: its_ttest
corpus: compare means of two samples using independent ttest

info.description: Two Sample Student's t-test: This test is used to compare the means of two independent samples. It assumes that the data is normally distributed and that the variances of the two groups are equal.

modules.name: p_ttest
corpus: compare means of two samples using dependent ttest

info.description: Perform a paired two-sample t-test, which is used to determine if there is a significant difference between the means of two related groups or conditions. In a paired t-test, each observation in one group is paired or matched with a corresponding observation in the other group. This pairing could be based on before-and-after measurements, measurements on the same subjects at different times, or any other related pairing.

modules.name: os_ttest
corpus: compare sample mean to population mean using ttest

info.description: A one-sample t-test is a statistical test used to determine whether the mean of a sample significantly differs from a known or hypothesized population mean. It is typically used when we have a single sample and want to compare its mean to a specific value.

The Mann-Whitney test, also known as the Wilcoxon rank-sum test, is a nonparametric statistical test used to determine whether there is a significant difference between the distributions of two independent samples. It is often used when the data does not meet the assumptions of parametric tests like the t-test.

modules.name: ks_sample_normal
corpus: kolmogorov smirnov test for normal distribution
one sample ks test for normal distribution

info.description: The Kolmogorov-Smirnov (KS) test for an normal distribution is a statistical test used to determine if a sample of data follows an normal distribution. It compares the empirical cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the sample data with the theoretical CDF of the normal distribution.

modules.name: ks_sample_uniform
corpus: kolmogorov smirnov test for uniform distribution
one sample ks test for uniform distribution

info.description: The Kolmogorov-Smirnov (KS) test for an uniform distribution is a statistical test used to determine if a sample of data follows an uniform distribution. It compares the empirical cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the sample data with the theoretical CDF of the uniform distribution.

modules.name: ks_sample_exponential
corpus: kolmogorov smirnov test for exponential distribution
one sample ks test for exponential distribution

info.description: The Kolmogorov-Smirnov (KS) test for an exponential distribution is a statistical test used to determine if a sample of data follows an exponential distribution. It compares the empirical cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the sample data with the theoretical CDF of the exponential distribution.

modules.name: lilliefors_normal
corpus: one sample lilliefors test for normal distribution

info.description: The Lilliefors test, also known as the Kolmogorov-Smirnov test for normality, is a statistical test used to determine whether a sample comes from a normal distribution. It is an extension of the Kolmogorov-Smirnov test, which is used to test the goodness-of-fit of any continuous distribution.

modules.name: shapirowilk_normal
corpus: shapiro wilk test for normal distribution

info.description: The Shapiro-Wilk test is a statistical test used to determine if a given sample of data comes from a normally distributed population. It is a widely-used test for normality in statistical analysis. The Shapiro-Wilk test is particularly useful when the sample size is small (typically less than 50) and when the assumption of normality is crucial for subsequent statistical analysis, such as parametric tests like t-tests or ANOVA.

The chi-square test in scipy is a statistical test used to determine if there is a significant association between two categorical variables. It is based on the chi-square statistic, which measures the difference between the observed and expected frequencies of each category

modules.name: chi2_test_peng
corpus: chi2 categorical association test using pingouin
chi2 category frequency test using pingouin

info.description: The chi-square test in scipy is a statistical test used to determine if there is a significant association between two categorical variables. It is based on the chi-square statistic, which measures the difference between the observed and expected frequencies of each category

modules.name: jarque_bera_normal
corpus: test for normal distribution using jarque bera

info.description: The Jarque-Bera test is a statistical test used to determine whether a given dataset follows a normal distribution. It is based on the skewness and kurtosis of the data.

modules.name: two_sample_anova
corpus: one way analysis of variance test
one way two sample anova test

info.description: Performs a one-way ANOVA (Analysis of Variance) test, which is used to determine if there are any statistically significant differences between the means of two groups
